articles.title: Prediction: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Stock Is the Safest AI Chip Bet
articles.content: TSMC has become the undisputed foundry leader.  Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing (NYSE: TSM) may not design artificial intelligence (AI) chips, but it's a company that every AI chipmaker relies on.  The AI giants rely on TSMC to manufacture their number-crunching chip designs.

articles.title: Why You Shouldn’t Buy an iPhone Right Now
articles.content: A new iPhone 16? Not now. If you can hold off for a couple more months, better trade-in deals and price drops await.

articles.title: Will a Leadership Change Be Enough to Turn Apple Around?
articles.content: COO Jeff Williams is retiring, and will be replaced by a 30-year Apple employee and top executive.  Apple's growth has stalled in recent years and it will be up to the new COO to make some progress.  Longtime Chief Operating Officer Jeff Williams is retiring and will be replaced by Sabih Khan, the company's senior vice president of operations.

articles.title: These 5 Technology Stocks Are Money-Printing Machines
articles.content: Large technology companies generate lots of revenue and cash flow.  Apple (NASDAQ: AAPL) has built an amazing ecosystem of consumer products and related services.  It utilized that robust cash flow and its cash-rich balance sheet (over $132 billion in cash, cash equivalents, and marketable securities) to return $29 billion to its shareholders in the quarter via dividends and share repurchases.

articles.title: 'Magnificent 7' check-in: Why these 3 names might not 'belong'
articles.content: Spear Invest founder and chief investment officer Ivana Delevska joins BD8 Capital Partners CEO and chief investment officer Barbara Doran and Market Catalysts host Julie Hyman to check in on the "Magnificent Seven," noting the growing dissimilarities between stock names.
